text: And a raven that was going about with little food saw a raven sleeping in the sun in the pasture; and he fell swiftly upon it, and took it away. But the hornet, waking up from her sleep, turned and bit her. And the raven, seeing it die, said, Woe to me, for I have found a treasure, but at the cost of my life! Before you take anything, decide if it's worth the cost.
title: El cuervo y la culebra
author: nan Esopo
